child.pub-comments: Author explains that he purposely excludes Kpele from the present study, but that it has a notably distinct vocabulary from the Mana-busa languages studied here and therefore deserves a separate study, together with the Mandé-sud languages situated further west: Toma, Gbande, Gbunde, Mende, Susu (Prost 1953: 9-10).

child.pub-comments: Author specifies that the 'Boko' and 'Busa' included in this study are two vocabularies of the same language, Busa, and not necessarily two distinct dialects (Prost 1953:10).
child.geography: In the city of Boussa on the Niger and the city of Kayama in Nigeria

child.pub-comments: Author notes that Vaï and Bamana were formerly considered to be part of the outdated "mandé-tan" group, separate from Mandé-sud, but he asserts that they hold more similarity to languages in the Mana-Busa group than those in the Kpele-Mende group do (Prost 1953).
